intro: Bipontinia corylifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to parts of East Asia. It is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that are typically 10–20 cm in diameter. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in catkins, which are followed by winged fruits. It thrives in moist, fertile soils and is often found in riparian zones. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
